oneOf.description: Supported architecture. The defaults are 'x86' and 'x64'.
List of supported architectures. The defaults are 'x86' and 'x64'.
Each item contains the script name with constraints and command (eq. '"clear-cache:linux": "rm -r ./cache"').
Each item contains the script name with constraints and commands (eq. '"clear-cache:linux": "rm -r ./cache"').

items.description: The list of commands executed one by one. Commands are executed as long as previous command exits with status code 0.

___scripts.description: List of user and system callbacks scripts.

___type.description: Either 'library' for static and shared libraries or 'project' for executable projects. The default value is 'library'.

items.description: Each item contains the package name and version constraint, additionally the linking type constraint (eq. '"org/package": "^5.3:static"').

oneOf.description: Support only one linking type. By default supports both, the static and dynamic linking.
List of supported linking types. The defaults are 'static' and 'dynamic'.

___source.description: Path to the directory containing source files (.c and .cpp). The default is 'src'.

___repositories.description: List of repositories to search for packages before looking up to the official one.

___src.description: Repository source, eq. directory path for local repository etc.

___type.description: Type of the repository, eq. local, git, register etc.

oneOf.description: Supported platform. If no platform is specified then it's assumed that all platforms are supported.
List of supported platforms. If no platforms are specified then it's assumed that all platforms are supported.

___include.description: Path to the directory containing header files (.h and .hpp). The default is 'include'.

___compiler.description: List of supported compilers. By default one of the locally supported compilers is used.

additionalProperties.description: The compiler name (key) and version constraint (value).

___dev-dependencies.description: List of required dependencies while developing (i.e. package is the root one).
